[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The E-Commerce System (ECS) defines technical requirements for authentication, payments, inventory tracking, and secure transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ECS ensures authentication, inventory tracking, and fraud prevention.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ECS integrates with authentication, payment, and inventory services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ECS provides web and mobile UI for customers, vendors, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ECS runs on cloud-based, load-balanced infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ECS uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL, and Redis caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ECS secures data via TLS 1.3 and API encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ECS optimizes transactions with caching and indexing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ECS handles authentication, payments, inventory, and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ECS supports multi-device access and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ECS connects to authentication, payment, and inventory APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ECS ensures authentication, inventory tracking, and fraud prevention.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ECS serves customers, vendors, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ECS requires internet and cloud hosting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ECS relies on encryption, payment gateways, and secure APIs.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with payment and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall enforce RBAC for all users.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enforce authentication, restricting access to authorized users (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track inventory, manage vendors, and notify administrators of shortages (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for transactions (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall ensure high availability and database optimization (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with monitoring (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user profiles, products, transactions, and inventory records (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce RBAC to restrict access to sensitive data (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with best practices for authentication, access control, and encryption (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure uptime, security, and fraud control (REQ-DSGN-001, REQ-COMP-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Transaction security, access control, performance, and database integrity validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, security policies, and payment processing guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: E-commerce security protocols, PCI-DSS compliance, and OAuth 2.0 authentication standards.
